Detailed Description

Implements a login window whereby the user can enter account information and have it remembered.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

LoginPanel::LoginPanel ( wxWindow *  parent,
bool  autoLogin = false 
)

Creates the login panel.

Parameters:
parent the owning frame (most likely MainWindow)
autoLogin if set to true, will attempt to automatically login using any saved account settings

Member Function Documentation

LoginPanel::DECLARE_EVENT_TABLE (  ) 

void LoginPanel::InitializeComponents (  )  [private]

Initializes window components.

void LoginPanel::Login (  )  [protected]

Performs a verification of the login credentials using the account settings set in the text boxes.

Sets the loggedIn status to true if the authorization succeeds.

Warning:
This code runs in a thread via a ThreadCallback and should therefore not attempt to directly interact with the GUI.

void LoginPanel::OnLogin ( wxCommandEvent &  evt  ) 

Activated when the login button is pressed.

Initiates a ThreadCallback to Login and waits for loggedIn to be filled. Times out after 10 seconds.

Here is the call graph for this function:

void LoginPanel::OnLoginFailed ( wxCommandEvent &  evt  ) 

Displays an error message if authorization fails.

void LoginPanel::OnLoginSuccess ( wxCommandEvent &  evt  ) 

Activated when Login succeeds.

Saves account settings if "remember me" is checked. Shows the main panel

void LoginPanel::OnPaint ( wxPaintEvent &  evt  ) 

Catch the paint event to draw the logo.

This is done because wxStaticBitmap does not support images larger than 64x64.

Here is the call graph for this function:

void LoginPanel::OnText ( wxCommandEvent &  evt  ) 

Handle the text event in the password box so that the ENTER key will act as if the user clicked the login button.
